text: petition for revaluation in addition to the valuation procedure under rsa and the option for annual appraisal under rsa voters may petition the local governing body to conduct a full revaluation of property within the municipality to qualify the petition shall contain the signatures of at least percent of the total number of registered voters in the municipality collected over a period provided that if the municipality has a lower threshold for consideration of a warrant article the lower threshold shall apply when a qualifying petition is submitted the governing body shall take up the question of whether to conduct a revaluation in the following manner in a town other than a town that has adopted a charter pursuant to rsa the question shall be placed on the warrant of a special or annual town meeting by the governing body or by petition pursuant to rsa in a city or town that has adopted a charter pursuant to rsa or rsa the governing body shall consider and act upon the question in accordance with its normal procedures for passage of resolutions ordinances and other legislation provided that in no case shall the petition be simply received and filed without further action or vote by the body in the alternative the governing body of such municipality may place the question on the official ballot for any regular municipal election
